Republican Rep: John Ratcliffe asked witnesses William Taylor and George Kent if either of them were there to assert there was an impeachable offense in the call between Trump and the Ukrainian president.
Taylor paused and attempted to respond: but Ratcliffe cut him off and withdrew the question.
Taylor eventually got an opportunity to: stating that neither he nor Kent were there to decide about impeachment, as it was the job of the House.
Contrary to Trump: s claim, Taylor did not stare straight ahead with a blank look on his face, remain silent, or be unable to answer the question. He briefly paused before responding.
